snippet: A study found that a significant number of people labeled vegetative had received an incorrect diagnosis and actually had some degree of consciousness and the potential to improve.
abstract: Study published in The Lancet finds that significant number of people labeled vegetative after entering a coma have received incorrect diagnosis and actually have some degree of consciousness and potential to improve; study employed PET scans and a type of MRI scans to measure brain activity.
lead_paragraph: A study found that a significant number of people labeled vegetative had received an incorrect diagnosis and actually had some degree of consciousness and the potential to improve.

headline.main: PET Scans Offer Clues on Vegetative States
headline.print_headline: PET Scans Offer Clues on Vegetative States
